title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: I have an 820-3536a that turns on now. but has an x through the battery and says "no battery detected" if i unplug the charger with the computer on, the screen goes black but the fan continues to spin until the battery is disconnected. In diode mode i get .316 on pin 1 of R5380 and R5381. R5380 gives me 2k ohms and R5381 gives me 1.65k ohms

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message:
Are you getting 3.42V on SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL & SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA ?

Not a huge amount to check here.
Bad U7100, Battery or SMC.

Also check current sense pairs
R7151 & R7152,  
R7121 & R7122

Whats history of board ? liquid ?

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: I get 1.5 mv on SCL, SDA jumps around a lot. 2.5 ohms on R7151 .4 ohms on R7152 10 ohms on R7121 10 ohms on 7122, the board looks absolutely fine, no evidence of liquid anywhere

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message:
Something is bring those data lines down.

check D7050 for corrosion. Other than that disconnect battery, see if data lines get back to 3V.

Probably bad SMC, but these don't usually go bad by themselves.

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: d7050 looks perfect  the SCL data line has a 1 ohm resistance to ground

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message:
some thing is bring that data line down

u7100, battery or SMC. your pick.......

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: wasnt the battery, ill pull u7100

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: U7100... Also, Does this have liquid damage? I get stuff all the time in my shop that has no liquid and the ISL is bad.

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: I cant see any liquid damage at all

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: It's probably the ISL then.. Seems to be one of the more common chips to fail randomly.

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: Remove ISL first and check if resistance on SCL data line goes up, if wont, SMC is bad....

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: removed the isl short is gone

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: Then there you go!

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: okay so new problem, now when i plug in the charger it turns on, but then shuts back off about 3 seconds later and stays off

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: then you fucked something up changing the isl as it was working before this. double check your work and make sure you did not move anything out of where it should be, this happens a lot. back track all your work you have done since this issue has come up and make sure everything is in place.  also did you placed the isl in the proper position?

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: when I put the isl back on it wasnt flat to the board, seems to be all fixed

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: now i have a 1ohm short to ground on the same line again

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: Well i guess that leaves only one component.

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: pulled the isl again shorts gone again.... not sure what im doing wrong here

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: what is the resistance with ISL out?? in both data lines.....

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: I pulled an isl from a donor board, for some reason the new ones from the spool didnt work but that one did, computer sees the battery now, thanks for the help guys

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: Where did the ISLs come from? This happens to me from time to time and is why I like donor boards for things I can't buy directly from mouser or digikey. If from us, PM me an order number so I can get to the bottom of it!

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: looks like I bought them from L2 computer in september of last year

title: 820-3536 wont detect battery
message: Well there you go... L2 sells trash. Avoid them like the plaque... By from Louis or a place called Beetstech. I still get a bad one from the reel every now and then.
